extendedIngredients.name: ears corn
extendedIngredients.original: 8 ears fresh corn, shucked and halved crosswise
extendedIngredients.originalName: ears fresh corn, shucked and halved crosswise

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 4 pounds unpeeled jumbo shrimp (21 to 25 count)

extendedIngredients.name: old bay seasoning
extendedIngredients.original: Original Old Bay Seasoning Shrimp Boil
extendedIngredients.originalName: Original Old Bay Seasoning Shrimp Boil

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: Stir in shrimp. Cook 4 minutes or just until shrimp turn pink.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Stir in shrimp. Cook minutes or just until shrimp turn pink

extendedIngredients.name: smoked sausage
extendedIngredients.original: 2 pounds lean smoked sausage, cut into 2-inch pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: lean smoked sausage, cut into 2-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: water
extendedIngredients.original: Bring water, beer, OLD BAY Seasoning and salt to boil in 12-quart stockpot on high heat. Add potatoes and onions. Cook 8 minutes. Add smoked sausage. Cook 5 minutes. Add corn. Cook 7 minutes.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Bring water, beer, OLD BAY Seasoning and salt to boil in stockpot on high heat. Add potatoes and onions. Cook 8 minutes. Add smoked sausage. Cook 5 minutes. Add corn. Cook 7 minutes

extendedIngredients.name: east coast meets midwest
extendedIngredients.original: East Coast Meets Midwest (Recipe: Shrimp Boil)
extendedIngredients.originalName: East Coast Meets Midwest (Recipe: Shrimp Boil)

extendedIngredients.name: platter. or
extendedIngredients.original: Drain cooking liquid. Pour contents of pot into large serving bowl or platter. Or, mound on paper-covered table. Sprinkle with additional OLD BAY Seasoning, if desired.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Drain cooking liquid. Pour contents of pot into bowl or platter. Or, mound on paper-covered table. Sprinkle with additional OLD BAY Seasoning, if desired

title: East Coast Meets Midwest (: Shrimp Boil)
summary: East Coast Meets Midwest (: Shrimp Boil) is a gluten free and dairy free main course. For $7.44 per serving, this recipe covers 45% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 841 calories, 69g of protein, and 35g of fat. This recipe serves 8. If you have water, sausage, potatoes, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the water you could follow this main course with the Watermelon-Peach Slushies as a dessert. 15 people were glad they tried this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 90%. This score is awesome. Try East-Meets-West Best: Kyoto Sloppy Joe, East Meets West Barbecue Sauce, and East-meets-southwest Chicken Tostada Salad for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Zind-Humbrecht Calcaire Pinot Gris with a 4.7 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 46 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Calcaire Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Bright yellow/gold color, quite luminous. Superb smoky toasty nose, typical for this grape on limestone in Alsace (no new oak in our wines, just very long total lees contact). Some light reductive aromas that actually fit the style of dry Pinot-Gris. The palate is rich and creamy, with a velvety texture yet fully dry. It is an easy wine to drink now as there is no unnecessary weight. The finish is nice and round but fully dry. The complex limestone blend brings great acid balance and a certain weight. It should develop very nicely over the next few years.
